title: [2/26] NA Login Issues - RESOLVED
body:
> #***UPDATE 4:09pm PST***

> We believe that the latest rounds of fixes we deployed seemed to have resolved the issue.  We are going to continue monitoring closely, but once the initial login queue is drained, there should be no long waits getting into the client.

>  Thanks for everyone sticking with us during this! <3!

--------------------------------------------------------------

> #***UPDATE 3:46pm PST***

> Fixes have been deployed and we re-enabled the Login Queue.  We are still in the testing phase, so we are going to keep a close eye on things to see if anything changes.

> More updates to follow once we get a better idea!

--------------------------------------------------------------

> #***UPDATE 3:43pm PST***

> We got another round of fixes that we are going to try and deploy out.  Unfortunately this means we have to disable the login queue again.  For the time being, no one will be able to enter the queue!

> Once they are deployed and the queue is back up, we'll update everyone.  

--------------------------------------------------------------

> #***UPDATE 3:29pm PST***

> The fixes we deployed earlier hasn't seemed to resolve the root cause of the issue.  We are currently looking at other possible solutions and are heads down focused.

> I wish I could give some better news, but once we have some new information, I'll update everyone!

--------------------------------------------------------------

> #***UPDATE 2:44pm PST***

> We deployed the fixes and brought the login queue back up.  We are still heavily monitoring and testing to see if this has helped drain the login queue and allowed players to get into the client quickly.

> Once we get some further info or confirmations, we'll pass it along!

--------------------------------------------------

> #***UPDATE 2:31pm PST***

>We are deploying some additional fixes that should hopefully get everyone into the client faster.  In doing so, we actually have to pause the login queue.  For the time being, no one will be able to get past the queue.

>As soon as this fix is deployed (no exact ETA just yet), we are going to flip the switch back on and hopefully get everyone in quicker.

----------------------------------------------

> #***UPDATE 2:16pm PST***

> We are currently testing some changes to the login queue that should help get players in smoothly.  We haven't pushed the change out completely though. We want to make sure to do a limited test first to make sure it doesn't cause any further issues.

>Once we get some results from the test, we'll update all of you!

-----------------------------------------------------------

Hey everyone,

We know that many of you are experiencing a hefty login queue getting into the client.  We have been tracking this issue since it started around ~9:30am PST and have all hands on deck investigating and triaging.  While we can’t provide an ETA currently, we will provide further updates once we get more information.  You can also check out the [Server Status Page](http://status.leagueoflegends.com/?en_US#na).

In the meantime, if you get into queue to login, just sit tight and we’ll get you into the client as quickly as we can.

replies.body:
The wait times are phe-nami-nal.
Riot never Garen-teed us any compensation for this wait time.
This is not nasus-arily the end of the world, just be patient.
There are plenty of vi-able alternatives to playing league.
I urgot to tell you, your puns are udyr-ly ridiculous. 
I just saw twisted fate get decked. He spent the remainder of the game playing 52 card pick up.
Nami has excellent waveclear. 
Riot stop with these shen-anigans. 
When ziggs kills anivia she eggsplodes.
I'm feeling rather corki right now.
Playing lee sin in ranked is a bad idea, because it's not blind pick. 
However, gragas loves ranked because it's draft pick. 
When malphite carries rock hard it reminds me of brokeback mountain.
^.^
Oh and one more, Riot's response to people demanding free skins and stuff as compensation: 
YOU CAN'T MILK THOSE. >.<
Can you advise at all as to why the que is moving backwards?
RIGHT!? I've been in que to log in for almost two hours now, and my waiting time has gone from 2 hours and 40 mins to 3 hours and 56 mins. I mean, WTAF?!{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

While it frickin' sucks that it happens, let me try to explain a little as to why:

When you first enter the queue, the system attempts to give you a position and time based on how many people exist in the queue, and how quickly players are getting in.  The problem here is that the "players getting in" part is fluid.  Every so often the system re-calculates the rates in which players are getting in, realizes it is slower than it thought, so it pushes your wait time further back.

This is why one of the main focuses of us is not only to solve this at the root cause level, but also find ways to get players past the queue and into the client as quickly as possible.

I'm terribly sorry about the players asking for free handouts as compensation. To me that defines their character and integrity and in my opinion "free stuff" should NEVER be expected. The point of getting free things is that you don't expect them or they aren't required; if people are going to flame the company for not getting free skins when the game is already free to play I only see them as spoiled. I NEVER ask for free anything, no matter if my pizza was late, or there was a hole in my jeans, because that's a direct insult to the company that you think doesn't care about you, the player base. Imagine if you got a free skin every time riot had an incident. That's just not profitable. And before you start whining about them being filthy rich, WHO DO YOU THINK IS MAKING THEM THAT WAY? YOU! So why are you complaining about people taking your money... when you are giving it to them? I can only assume that if you are buying skins, you like the game? They have more than 1 employee to pay, along with servers and legal rights and lawyers and all that jazz. It's not a bunch of bozos sitting on their couch at home drinking kool-aid and going hey, let's draw a new skin today!

I really appreciate the kind words, but no need to apologize on behalf of anyone, I completely understand the anger (and demands) some players have.  There is an expectation that the game will be available to be played, and it isn't.  Straight up, that simply isn't cool.

Just to clarify further, we detected the problem almost as soon as it started, roughly at 9:31am PST.  ***Within a minute*** we activated comp mode to ensure that no one lost LP or had other punishments for getting disconnected, and not being able to log back in.  Subsequently we updated our Server Status Page, our RiotSupport Twitter, and made this Boards post to get as much information and transparency out there as possible.

We have people working non-stop to get this resolved as quickly as possible, and we aren't going to stop until we do.

I dont understand how it is that you dont feel it your responsibility to make it up to your players when you guys poop your sheets like this.  you mike INSANE money yearly on a great game, but you continue to allocate that into just about anything but client/server stability, 'yeah lets make stuffed animals, i bet we could make money that way too!'  and i get it, get paid.  but when you take away the opportunity to play from so many players why would you not offer like a free skin cupon or even a ward skin. something, it just feels disrespectful. if we have connection issues in a game 'god forbid' we can get leaverbusterd, what happens to you guys when you dc?

oh .

I've been waiting for 2 hours non stop.

You know what kept me calm?


The fact that Riot is solving the problem and that not all problems are simple to solve. People are quick to sneer at Riot but they are trying their best.
How much you wanna bet if this issue affected finances or credit card processing or anything that had to do with income... The problem would of been fixed in 5 minutes

Meh, EU LCS is on, so the timing is pretty good for a server issue for us.
At least we have that to keep us entertained!
Hope ya'll aren't bashing your heads against the wall too hard, seems like an annoying issue

Riot: "Our NA viewership for EULCS is low.. What can we do!?"
Lols xD
Come on dude. Has QT ever been wrong about anything ever?

Theory: the new app is causing people to appear to be attempting to log in, which messes up the server, causing the login delay. I have no idea of this is a technically sound theory, but just an idea.
So, can you at least tell us if there are legitimately over 20k people trying to log on or is there a bug duplicating logins?
Every second this is going on Dota is winning
if we get a free mystery skin im okay with all this riot just saying :D

I feel like Riot never gives answers to request like this, they don't really let anyone know whats going on because they would rather us know that they are "working on the issues" and leave links to the server status page with little to no insight on what is actually happening.

I understand that these problems can get pretty complex, but I feel like they think the average summoner is too stupid to comprehend what is going on. 

I would be so much more chill if I just knew what was going on.

strongly agree with this wish Riot would Update this page. Its just a bunch of people complaining. They need some mods on the forums letting people know whats up. In real time Like live help chat maybe? I know thats a bit much but riot plz let us know whats going on
RITO WHY YOU RUINED MY FRIDAY!{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}} {{item:3070}}

So i saw i had to wait 3 hours and i was like ok let me just get on xbox and wait it out.I turn on my xbox one and guess what...it needs an update now to wait 30mins for that i cry now{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}
League is not life.  League is not life.  *takes deep breath* *punches wall* *bones crack* League is not life.  League is not life... *gentle sobbing*

Rito you have more money than this.
Are you hiring?  Cuz u need my help.

Honestly, at this rate, Riot should give everyone Ip boosts or a skin or something for this hectic mess. I mean, this is just insanely annoying to not even come back and play the only game that I can play with my friends. It's unfair and they didn't even give a warning to the fact they were gonna be doing this new "smooth" way of logging in. At least a little heads up next time Rito. Or, better yet, turn off the servers for an hour and do the testing then.
Not all day and let only a select few on. That's just down right rediculousness.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Edit: I wouldn't even be upset if they had given any prior warning to this. But they just sprung it on us. Literally no prior warning for a 8 hour problem.

Edit 2: It's about time. They finally fixed it nearly 9 and a half hours after the problem was discovered. Can't wait for this to happen again.
The one day this week I'm off from school and work...
Approximate wait time until becoming lifelong Dota2 user instead: 2 hr 48min
I was so excited to get off my first job early enough to get a couple games in before my night job. Approximate wait time: 3hr 23min {{item:3073}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3073}}
